New Records: Glenn Maxwell set a new record for the fastest century at an ICC Men's Cricket World Cup, scoring 100 runs off just 40 balls.
Key Match Events: Glenn Maxwell scored a century off 40 balls for Australia against Netherlands.
Australia crushed Netherlands by a record-breaking 309 runs.
Maxwell and Pat Cummins put on 103 runs from 44 balls for the seventh wicket.
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Maxwell expressed humility about his performance, stating he didn't expect much due to illness.
Pat Cummins praised Maxwell's performance, calling it a 'freak show'.
Maxwell hopes his performance will boost his confidence for the remainder of the tournament.
Maxwell felt special performing in front of his wife and newborn son.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Maxwell's innings came after a poor run of form in ODI cricket.
Maxwell's reverse sweep was a key part of his innings.
The Dutch team struggled to contain Maxwell's batting.
